de.esoco.process.step.entity

Class SelectEntities<E extends Entity>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • org.obrel.core.SerializableRelatedObject
        • de.esoco.process.ProcessElement
          • de.esoco.process.ProcessFragment
            • de.esoco.process.step.InteractionFragment
              • de.esoco.process.step.entity.SelectEntities<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.manage.Initializable, java.io.Serializable, org.obrel.core.Relatable

    public class SelectEntities<E extends Entity>
extends InteractionFragment
    A process fragment that allows the interactive selection of entities of a certain type. It consists of two lists with the source entities on the left, the selected entities on the right, and list manipulation buttons between the lists.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • SelectEntities

        public SelectEntities(java.lang.String sIdentifier,
                      java.lang.Class<E> rEntityClass,
                      java.util.List<de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<? super E,?>> rColumns)
        Creates a new instance with specific parameters. The given identifier string must be unique in the context of this instance because it will be used to generate temporary parameters and resource identifiers.
        Parameters:
        sIdentifier - An identifier string for this instance
        rEntityClass - The class of the entities to be selected
        rColumns - The entity attribute functions for the table columns to be displayed; empty to use the entity attributes of EntityDefinition.DisplayMode.COMPACT

    • Method Detail

      • getEntityListPredicate

        public static <E extends Entity> de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<E> getEntityListPredicate(java.lang.Class<E> rEntityClass,
                                                                                             java.util.Collection<E> rEntities)
        Returns a predicate that can be used as the criteria of a storage query for a certain set of entities based on their ID.
        Parameters:
        rEntityClass - The entity class of the list elements
        rEntities - The entities to create the predicate for (can be NULL for none)
        Returns:
        A predicate containing the entity ID criteria for the given entities

The default implementation returns a mutable collection that can been modified directly by a subclass. Or it can be overridden by subclasses to return their own input parameter collection.

      • prepareInteraction

        public void prepareInteraction()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: InteractionFragment
        Can be implemented by subclasses to initialize the interaction of this fragment. This method will be invoked on every iteration of this fragment's interaction, i.e. on the first run and every time after an interaction event occurred. The default implementation does nothing.
        Overrides:
        prepareInteraction in class InteractionFragment
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Any kind of exception may be thrown in case of errors

      • querySelectedEntities

        public final java.util.List<E> querySelectedEntities()
                                              throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Queries a list of the currently selected entities.
        Returns:
        A new list containing the selected entities
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If the query fails

      • setEntityInfoFunction

        public final void setEntityInfoFunction(de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<? super E,java.lang.String> fCreateEntityInfo)
        Sets a function that generate an information string for an input entity. This information will then be displayed on selection of an entity.
        Parameters:
        fCreateEntityInfo - The entity info function

      • setQueryConstraints

        public void setQueryConstraints(de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super E> pCriteria,
                                de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super Entity> pSort)
        Sets the query constraints of this instance. This will also reset the current selection and should therefore only be invoked if the constraints actually have changed.
        Parameters:
        pCriteria - The query criteria or NULL for all entities of the chosen type
        pSort - The sort predicate or NULL for no explicit order

      • setSelectedEntityIds

        public final void setSelectedEntityIds(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Long> rIds)
        Sets the selection of this instance to the given entity IDs that match the current query criteria. Entity IDs, which entity does not comply with the current query criteria are filtered out.
        Parameters:
        rIds - A collection containing the IDs of the entities to select

      • setSelectionColumns

        public void setSelectionColumns(java.util.List<de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<? super E,?>> rSelectionColumns)
        Sets the column attributes to be displayed in the table containing the selected entities. If not they will default to the same columns as the all entities table.
        Parameters:
        rSelectionColumns - The columns of the selection table

      • update

        public void update()
            throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Updates the query criteria of this instance and re-initializes the storage query. All other parameters like columns or sort order must have been set before to be considered for the update.
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException

      • afterInteraction

        protected void afterInteraction(org.obrel.core.RelationType<?> rInteractionParam)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Can be implemented by subclasses to react on interactions that occurred in other fragments. This method will be invoked after InteractionFragment.handleInteraction(RelationType). The default implementation does nothing.
        Overrides:
        afterInteraction in class InteractionFragment
        Parameters:
        rInteractionParam - The interaction parameter
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Any kind of exception may be thrown in case of errors

        protected void initProcessStep(Interaction rProcessStep)
        Will be invoked after the process step of this fragment has been set. Can be implemented by subclasses to initialize process step-specific parameters. The default implementation does nothing.
        Overrides:
        initProcessStep in class InteractionFragment
        Parameters:
        rProcessStep - The process step of this fragment
